intro: Dendranthema chalchingolicum, commonly known as the Chinese chrysanthemum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features aromatic, hairy leaves. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant blooms and resilience in various climates. The flowers are used in traditional Chinese medicine and are also popular in horticulture for their aesthetic value.
